CLEIMSON UNIVERSITY
CLEMSON, SOUTH CAROLINA 3SQ31
UNIVERSITY COMMUNICATIONS CENTER
April 25, 1967
Mr. Jerrold Sandler
Executive Director
National Educational Radio
Division of National Association
of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
Dear Jerry:
I have just finished reading your statement
before the sub-committee on communications of the
Senate commerce committee. And I must say that
I am impressed all over again with the work that
you folks have done within the past few months.
I thought this was an excellent statement,
really clarifying the role of educational radio
in our multi-media society. Your statement
and the magnificent study "The Hidden Medium",
have suggested to me a number of ways which we
may use educational radio if we can ever get
our interconnecting plans beyond the talking
stage.
I appreciate the note that your Adminstrative
Assistant sent me regarding my earlier letter.
It's quite evident ;that you've been very busy,
and in a most effective way. Perhaps we'll have
a chance to get together at the Board Meeting in
June. Best regards.
Sincerely,
Harry Durham, Director
University Communications
Center
WHD/hm
